intro: Streptocarpus haygarthii, commonly known as the Haygarth's streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tubular flowers and velvety foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a humid, well-lit environment. Its flowers are usually violet or blue in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
